comments.text: In an era where so many major releases want to be a live-service multiplayer grind, these focused, story-driven single-player experiences are the perfect palate cleanser to just sit back, relax, and get lost in a new world alone. Have you discovered the joy of these single player bangers? Which is your favorite? Comment below and subscribe for more PS5 games! https://wmojo.com/mojoplays-subscribe
comments.author: @mojoplays

comments.text: Some of these aren’t really overlooked but yeah, good list.
comments.author: @84bombsjetpack23

comments.text: Alan wake 2
comments.author: @bernardduchemin7292

comments.text:
I feel like Code Vein II should've been on this list—or a future list.

A number of outlets described the game as "mediocre" but after having played and platinuming it... I can't agree. Code Vein II had great character customization. The exploration was rewarding with cool stuff tucked away in all sorts of nooks and crannies. The combat was solid. The characters were memorable. The storytelling was at times beautiful and emotional. The bosses were challenging. Nothing about Code Vein II felt "mediocre."

Yeah, the bike could use some adjustments. Some bosses definitely need rebalancing. And there are mechanics and terms that could use better explanation. But still, I thought it was a darn fine game. Much better than other Soulslike titles such as Steel Rising or The Surge.
comments.author: @OtterloopB
